item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, February 17, 2025 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Fluoxetine promotes metabolic defenses to protect from sepsis-induced lethality (36 points | 13 comments)
2. 0+0 > 0: C++ thread-local storage performance (39 points | 10 comments)
3. Umami is a simple, fast, privacy-focused alternative to Google Analytics (145 points | 79 comments)
4. Homemade polarimetric synthetic aperture radar drone (422 points | 35 comments)
5. All Kindles can now be jailbroken (877 points | 299 comments)
6. Learning happens in environments optimized for understanding, not winning (7 points | discuss)
7. Uchū – Color palette for internet lovers (530 points | 209 comments)
8. Word embeddings – Part 3: The secret ingredients of Word2Vec (132 points | 10 comments)
9. Reflections on AGI from 1879 (33 points | 4 comments)
10. How do modern compilers choose which variables to put in registers? (222 points | 31 comments)
11. My Time at MIT (102 points | 18 comments)
12. Does or did COBOL default to 1875-05-20 for corrupt or missing dates? (187 points | 292 comments)
13. San Francisco homelessness: Park ranger helps one person at a time (243 points | 328 comments)
14. “A calculator app? Anyone could make that” (1593 points | 390 comments)

17. X users are unable to post “Signal.me” links (573 points | 494 comments)

23. Opposing arrows of time can theoretically emerge from certain quantum systems (78 points | 81 comments)

25. YouTube asks channel owner to verify phone, permanently overwrites personal info (316 points | 204 comments)
26. Half-Life 2 and Dishonored art lead Viktor Antonov has died (507 points | 101 comments)
27. OpenVINO AI effects [denoising and transcription] for Audacity (136 points | 25 comments)
28. Ugandan runner Jacob Kiplimo completes first ever sub-57 minute half marathon (128 points | 77 comments)
29. I use two trumpets to play the flute [video] (8 points | discuss)
30. Publish Your Gaussian Splats with SuperSplat (47 points | 8 comments)
